DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)._The replacement of tissue with tissue from the person's own body or from another person._Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
